title: Paper Curtain, 1872
medium:
Machine-printed on embossed paper
a/p) mounted on muslin  t,s)machine stitched threads r) metal rings s) brass eyes
inscribed: (v) in margin, printed twice, in black:  Registry mark of 29 July 1872
provenance: "a/s" Originally part of paper hung as two pairs of curtains, part hung on wall with nails. Purchased, Paris, 1946, backed with muslin, and hung by donor on apartment walls.
creditline: Gift of Mrs. Lester S. Abelson
description:
"a/q": Embossed in small-scale diamond-diaper pattern, vertical stripes: alternating white and bright blue backgrounds with short repeat floral and leaf patterns, symmetrical along vertical axes; strong multicolors, especially red, outlined in yellow. Stripes separated by black band between yellow lines, with string-of-beads pattern; "r/u": tie backs of blue background striped, hemmed ends folded into points, metal fittings "v" Narroew blue background strip with nail holes.

a/s) originally, part of paper hung as two pairs of curtains, part hung on wall with nails. Purshased, Paris, 1964, backed with muslin and hung by donor on apt. walls. holes in e, g, o. 

v) In margin printed twice; in blade: Registry mark of 29 July, 1872 (image in leger)

tombstone.epitaph:
Paper Curtain, 1872.
1872. Machine-printed on embossed paper
a/p) mounted on muslin  t,s)machine stitched threads r) metal rings s) brass eyes. Gift of Mrs. Lester S. Abelson. 1967-11-1-a/x.
